confirmed_facts: Fire broke out at approximately 14:50 local time on 26 November 2025 in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Tai Po, HongÂ Kong.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
The complex had 2,000 units with roughly 4,800 residents; 7 of 8 blocks were engulfed in flames.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the rapid spread of the fire.
Firefighters classified the incident as a 5â€‘level fire (highest severity) and are still conducting investigations.

timeline.event: Fire started at ~14:50 local time in Tai Po highâ€‘rise apartment complex.
Firefighters responded; 13 fatalities confirmed, 10 injuries reported.
Fire classified as 5â€‘level severity; investigation underway.
